39.heading: The Stone King.
39.title: Batman : the Stone King
39.author: Alan Grant.
notes: (Justice League of America)

Summary: "Something has been unearthed in Gotham City, something that should not have been disturbed. An ancient pyramid has unleashed supernatural energies throughout the world. Drawn to the eye of this arcane storm, the heroes of the JLA become caught in the grip of a force far beyond their extraordinary powers. Only Batman manages to escape
but to free his allies and stop the chaos that is fast engulfing the world, the Dark Knight must somehow unlock the pyramid's secret curse."
Superhero fiction.

113.author: a work of fiction by Jason Lutes.
notes: (Berlin ; 1)
"Originally serialized in the comic book Berlin, in issues 1 through 8."

114.heading: Stones.
114.title: "Den II"
114.author: by Richard Corben
114.appears_in: p. 17-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 9 (Dec. 1981).
notes: "While searching for the queen's powerful stones, Den, Tarn, and the others came across the queens' guards and a pit chock full o' hungry reptiles. Once the stones were found, the group's almost futile effort to return to their ship proved nearly all for nought, when Den and the stones went tumbling off the side, as the ship took flight. Tarn, an eternal enemy of Den's, caught him and saved Den's life."

136.heading: Stones.
136.title: "Two Birds with One Stone" p. 53-60 in Insatiable
136.author: Fernando Caretta ; translated by Laura Petrarca (Seattle, WA : Eros Comix, 1998).
notes: Summary: To restore their dignity, two men kidnap a woman from a rival family. One man kills the other because he wants her alone; she seduces the other and then kills him.
